Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: osqueryi
Description: Your OS as a high-performance relational database

Arguments.Name: --alarm_timeout
Arguments.Description: Seconds to allow for shutdown. Minimum is 10

Arguments.Name: --carver_block_size
Arguments.Description: Size of blocks used for POSTing data back to remote endpoints

Arguments.Name: --carver_compression
Arguments.Description: Compress archives using zstd prior to upload (default false)

Arguments.Name: --carver_continue_endpoint
Arguments.Description: TLS/HTTPS endpoint that receives carved content after session creation

Arguments.Name: --carver_disable_function
Arguments.Description: Disable the osquery file carver function (default true)

Arguments.Name: --carver_expiry
Arguments.Description: Seconds to store successful carve result metadata (in carves table)

Arguments.Name: --carver_start_endpoint
Arguments.Description: TLS/HTTPS init endpoint for forensic carver

Arguments.Name: --config_accelerated_refresh
Arguments.Description: Interval to wait if reading a configuration fails

Arguments.Name: --config_check
Arguments.Description: Check the format of an osquery config and exit

Arguments.Name: --config_dump
Arguments.Description: Dump the contents of the configuration, then exit

Arguments.Name: --config_enable_backup
Arguments.Description: Backup config and use it when refresh fails

Arguments.Name: --config_refresh
Arguments.Description: Optional interval in seconds to re-read configuration

Arguments.Name: --config_tls_max_attempts
Arguments.Description: Number of attempts to retry a TLS config request

Arguments.Name: --database_dump
Arguments.Description: Dump the contents of the backing store

Arguments.Name: --database_path
Arguments.Description: If using a disk-based backing store, specify a path

Arguments.Name: --disable_carver
Arguments.Description: Disable the osquery file carver (default true)

Arguments.Name: --disable_enrollment
Arguments.Description: Disable enrollment functions on related config/logger plugins

Arguments.Name: --disable_reenrollment
Arguments.Description: Disable re-enrollment attempts if related plugins return invalid

Arguments.Name: --disable_tables
Arguments.Description: Comma-delimited list of table names to be disabled

Arguments.Name: --enable_extensions_watchdog
Arguments.Description: Enable userland watchdog for extensions processes

Arguments.Name: --enable_tables
Arguments.Description: Comma-delimited list of table names to be enabled

Arguments.Name: --enroll_always
Arguments.Description: On startup, send a new enrollment request

Arguments.Name: --enroll_secret_env
Arguments.Description: Name of environment variable holding enrollment-auth secret

Arguments.Name: --enroll_secret_path
Arguments.Description: Path to an optional client enrollment-auth secret

Arguments.Name: --extensions_autoload
Arguments.Description: Optional path to a list of autoloaded & managed extensions

Arguments.Name: --extensions_socket
Arguments.Description: Path to the extensions UNIX domain socket

Arguments.Name: --extensions_timeout
Arguments.Description: Seconds to wait for autoloaded extensions

Arguments.Name: --force
Arguments.Description: Force osqueryd to kill previously-running daemons

Arguments.Name: --logtostderr
Arguments.Description: Log messages to stderr in addition to the logger plugin(s)

Arguments.Name: --pidfile
Arguments.Description: Path to the daemon pidfile mutex

Arguments.Name: --tls_client_cert
Arguments.Description: Optional path to a TLS client-auth PEM certificate

Arguments.Name: --tls_client_key
Arguments.Description: Optional path to a TLS client-auth PEM private key

Arguments.Name: --tls_enroll_max_attempts
Arguments.Description: The total number of attempts that will be made to the enroll endpoint if a request fails, 0 for infinite

Arguments.Name: --tls_enroll_max_interval
Arguments.Description: Maximum wait time in seconds between enroll retry attempts

Arguments.Name: --tls_hostname
Arguments.Description: TLS/HTTPS hostname for Config, Logger, and Enroll plugins

Arguments.Name: --tls_server_certs
Arguments.Description: Optional path to a TLS server PEM certificate(s) bundle

Arguments.Name: --tls_session_timeout
Arguments.Description: TLS session keep alive timeout in seconds

Arguments.Name: --watchdog_delay
Arguments.Description: Initial delay in seconds before watchdog starts

Arguments.Name: --watchdog_forced_shutdown_delay
Arguments.Description: Seconds that the watchdog will wait to do a forced shutdown after a graceful shutdown request, when a resource limit is hit

Arguments.Name: --watchdog_latency_limit
Arguments.Description: Override watchdog profile CPU utilization latency limit

Arguments.Name: --watchdog_memory_limit
Arguments.Description: Override watchdog profile memory limit (e.g., 300, for 300MB)

Arguments.Name: --watchdog_utilization_limit
Arguments.Description: Override watchdog profile CPU utilization limit

Arguments.Name: --audit_allow_config
Arguments.Description: Allow the audit publisher to change auditing configuration

Arguments.Name: --audit_allow_fim_events
Arguments.Description: Allow the audit publisher to install filesystem-related rules

Arguments.Name: --audit_allow_process_events
Arguments.Description: Allow the audit publisher to install process-related rules

Arguments.Name: --audit_allow_sockets
Arguments.Description: Allow the audit publisher to install socket-related rules

Arguments.Name: --audit_allow_user_events
Arguments.Description: Allow the audit publisher to install user-related rules

Arguments.Name: --augeas_lenses
Arguments.Description: Directory that contains augeas lenses files

Arguments.Name: --aws_enable_proxy
Arguments.Description: Enable proxying of HTTP/HTTPS requests in AWS client config

Arguments.Name: --aws_firehose_period
Arguments.Description: Seconds between flushing logs to Firehose (default 10)

Arguments.Name: --aws_firehose_stream
Arguments.Description: Name of Firehose stream for logging

Arguments.Name: --aws_kinesis_period
Arguments.Description: Seconds between flushing logs to Kinesis (default 10)

Arguments.Name: --aws_kinesis_stream
Arguments.Description: Name of Kinesis stream for logging

Arguments.Name: --aws_profile_name
Arguments.Description: AWS profile for authentication and region configuration

Arguments.Name: --aws_proxy_host
Arguments.Description: Proxy host for use in AWS client config

Arguments.Name: --aws_proxy_password
Arguments.Description: Proxy password for use in AWS client config

Arguments.Name: --aws_proxy_port
Arguments.Description: Proxy port for use in AWS client config

Arguments.Name: --aws_proxy_scheme
Arguments.Description: Proxy HTTP scheme for use in AWS client config (http or https, default https)

Arguments.Name: --aws_proxy_username
Arguments.Description: Proxy username for use in AWS client config

Arguments.Name: --aws_sts_timeout
Arguments.Description: AWS STS assume role credential validity in seconds (default 3600)

Arguments.Name: --buffered_log_max
Arguments.Description: Maximum number of logs in buffered output plugins (0 = unlimited)

Arguments.Name: --decorations_top_level
Arguments.Description: Add decorators as top level JSON objects

Arguments.Name: --disable_audit
Arguments.Description: Disable receiving events from the audit subsystem

Arguments.Name: --disable_endpointsecurity
Arguments.Description: Disable receiving events from the EndpointSecurity subsystem

Arguments.Name: --disable_endpointsecurity_fim
Arguments.Description: Disable file events from the EndpointSecurity subsystem

Arguments.Name: --disable_hash_cache
Arguments.Description: Cache calculated file hashes, re-calculate only if inode times change

Arguments.Name: --distributed_interval
Arguments.Description: Seconds between polling for new queries (default 60)

Arguments.Name: --distributed_loginfo
Arguments.Description: Log the running distributed queries name at INFO level

Arguments.Name: --distributed_tls_max_attempts
Arguments.Description: Number of times to attempt a request

Arguments.Name: --distributed_tls_read_endpoint
Arguments.Description: TLS/HTTPS endpoint for distributed query retrieval

Arguments.Name: --distributed_tls_write_endpoint
Arguments.Description: TLS/HTTPS endpoint for distributed query results

Arguments.Name: --ephemeral
Arguments.Description: Skip pidfile and database state checks

Arguments.Name: --es_fim_mute_path_literal
Arguments.Description: Comma delimited list of path literals to be muted for FIM

Arguments.Name: --es_fim_mute_path_prefix
Arguments.Description: Comma delimited list of path prefxes to be muted for FIM

Arguments.Name: --events_expiry
Arguments.Description: Timeout to expire event subscriber results

Arguments.Name: --events_max
Arguments.Description: Maximum number of event batches per type to buffer

Arguments.Name: --extensions_default_index
Arguments.Description: Enable INDEX on all extension table columns (default true)

Arguments.Name: --hash_cache_max
Arguments.Description: Size of LRU file hash cache

Arguments.Name: --host_identifier
Arguments.Description: Field used to identify the host running osquery (hostname, uuid, instance, ephemeral, specified)

Arguments.Name: --logger_kafka_acks
Arguments.Description: The number of acknowledgments the leader has to receive (0, 1, 'all')

Arguments.Name: --logger_kafka_brokers
Arguments.Description: Bootstrap broker(s) as a comma-separated list of host or host:port (default port 9092)

Arguments.Name: --logger_kafka_compression
Arguments.Description: Compression codec to use for compressing message sets ('none' or 'gzip')

Arguments.Name: --logger_kafka_topic
Arguments.Description: Kafka topic to publish logs under

Arguments.Name: --logger_min_status
Arguments.Description: Minimum level for status log recording

Arguments.Name: --logger_min_stderr
Arguments.Description: Minimum level for statuses written to stderr

Arguments.Name: --logger_numerics
Arguments.Description: Use numeric JSON syntax for numeric values

Arguments.Name: --logger_path
Arguments.Description: Directory path for ERROR/WARN/INFO and results logging

Arguments.Name: --logger_rotate_max_files
Arguments.Description: Max number of files to keep in rotation

Arguments.Name: --logger_rotate_size
Arguments.Description: Size for each filesystem log in bytes

Arguments.Name: --logger_snapshot_event_type
Arguments.Description: Log scheduled snapshot results as events

Arguments.Name: --logger_syslog_facility
Arguments.Description: Syslog facility for status and results logs (0-23, default 19)

Arguments.Name: --logger_syslog_prepend_cee
Arguments.Description: Prepend @cee: tag to logged JSON messages

Arguments.Name: --logger_tls_max_lines
Arguments.Description: Max number of logs to send per period

Arguments.Name: --logger_tls_max_linesize
Arguments.Description: Max size in bytes allowed per log line

Arguments.Name: --logger_tls_period
Arguments.Description: Seconds between flushing logs over TLS/HTTPS

Arguments.Name: --nullvalue
Arguments.Description: Set string for NULL values, default ''

Arguments.Name: --numeric_monitoring_filesystem_path
Arguments.Description: File to dump numeric monitoring records one per line. The format of the line is <PATH><TAB><VALUE><TAB><TIMESTAMP>

Arguments.Name: --numeric_monitoring_plugins
Arguments.Description: Comma separated numeric monitoring plugins names

Arguments.Name: --numeric_monitoring_pre_aggregation_time
Arguments.Description: Time period in seconds for numeric monitoring pre-aggregation buffer

Arguments.Name: --pack_delimiter
Arguments.Description: Delimiter for pack and query names

Arguments.Name: --pack_refresh_interval
Arguments.Description: Cache expiration for a packs discovery queries

Arguments.Name: --schedule_default_interval
Arguments.Description: Query interval to use if none is provided

Arguments.Name: --schedule_lognames
Arguments.Description: Log the running scheduled query name at INFO level

Arguments.Name: --schedule_reload
Arguments.Description: Interval in seconds to reload database arenas

Arguments.Name: --schedule_timeout
Arguments.Description: Limit the schedule to a duration in seconds, 0 for no limit

Arguments.Name: --specified_identifier
Arguments.Description: Field used to specify the host_identifier when set to 'specified'

Arguments.Name: --table_delay
Arguments.Description: Add an optional microsecond delay between table scans

Arguments.Name: --thrift_string_size_limit
Arguments.Description: Sets the maximum string size allowed in a thrift message, use 0 for unlimited

Arguments.Name: --yara_delay
Arguments.Description: Time in ms to sleep after scan of each file (default 50) to reduce memory spikes

Arguments.Name: --extension
Arguments.Description: Path to a single extension to autoload

Arguments.Name: --pack
Arguments.Description: Run all queries in a pack

Arguments.Name: --profile
Arguments.Description: Enable profile mode when non-0, set number of iterations
